artist: Artist: Unknown Italian, 17th century; Artist: Formerly attributed to Ventura Salimbeni
description: two crouching men, back to back; right sketch light and unfinished; man at left wears belted tunic and pants
inscription:
Inscription and Stamp

bottom center on mount, in brown ink: [Salimbene]; bottom center on mount, in pencil: [B. 1557 D. 1613]; on back of mount, in purple pencil: [315]; on back of mount, in pencil: [6-140-10] and [9]; on back, in black ink: [W176]
medium: Black and white chalk on red prepared paper
provenance: Jean C. Genty, Lugt 3424, Lugano. Ephraim Collection, Lugano, as by Poccetti. Sale, Sotheby's, London, June 20, 1969, no. 16. Sale, Christie's, London, July 16, 1978, no. 3', to Scarpa; [Pietro Scarpa, Venice, 1978, sold for $1,250 to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1978-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Two Studies of a Seated Male Figure
